text.p: The following are top stories from selected Singapore newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Singapore Senior Minister Lee Kuan Yew says Japanese will not have monopoly in East Asia's liberalisation.
- Former Amcol Holdings executive director Ng Chee Kheong and corporate trader Peter Tay Huay Hong charged with conspiring to cheat Amcol into investing US$39.6 million in Mauritius resort project.
- Malaysia's 14 foreign banks chalk up total group earnings of Malaysian $660 million for the six months to June 30.
- Stock Exchange of Singapore and Singapore Press Holdings will launch Business Times-Singapore Regional Index at seminar next week.
- Contract manufacturer NatSteel Broadway Ltd becomes third company this year with undersubscribed shares.
- Three freehold properties owned by defunct cooperative housing society are up for auction.
- Thailand considers short-term measures to boost declining offshore confidence in economy.
- Local fruit and vegetable distributor and processor Fook Huat Tong Kee Group applies for primary listing.
- Straits Steamship Land awards construction contracts worth Signapore $163 million for two Raffles Place office projects.
- Singapore's Hong Leong group agrees to buy Britannia Hotel in London's fashionable Mayfair district for 81 million stlg.
